page.title: 11THE M6 MOTORWAY _ PART I
page.content: The{Golden Fleece}interchange on the M6 motorway is in the NE corner of our 12 Km block.Carlisle is on the major route to Scotland where the gap narrows between the Solway Firth and the Pennines.For many years it has been a bottle_neck for traffic and a by_pass was proposed as early as the 1930's but the war intervened and nothing more was done until 1960 when a traffic survey was done by the County Highways Dept.In 1962 the Ministry of Transport decided that the motorway network would finish just north of Carlisle.17 lines were considered at first and these were reduced to 4,all east of the city.The final choice was from the{Golden {Fleece}to{Greymoorhill.}The Golden Fleece interchange is a 2_level one with connections to the A6,Wetheral (eastwards)and Durdar(westwards).
